concept.title: HTTP status codes
concept.shortdesc: You can use standard HTTP status codes to understand the success or failure of a request.

li.p: The request has succeeded completely. A response body is provided that contains the results of the request.
The request has been accepted for processing, but processing is not complete.
The request was missing required input, had errors in the provided input, or included extraneous input.
Additional information regarding the error is provided in an error response body that includes a reason code with additional information.
The request is valid, but the server is not responding to the request.
The requested resource cannot be found or does not exist.
The request method is not recognized by the server, or the server is not able to complete the request.
The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.
